page.title: 20Village Fathers
page.content: Few fathers work in the village though the local coach company employs several.Most travel outside for their work by car as the bus service is poor .The R.A.F. Station at Leuchars employs many,but most work in Dundee which means crossing the Tay Road Toll Bridge at a cost of 30 pence.A campaign is underway to abolish the tolls.Others work in Wormit,St.Andrews and Glenrothes.Some travel to Aberdeen -70mls and then by helicopter to the oilrigs in the North and Irish Sea. Survey participants-Mrs.Marion Balfour (Headteacher),Philip Stevenson,George Thomson,James Drummond,Garry Wood, Stuart Foreman,Valerie Carmichael, Jennifer Ellis,Jennifer Hubbard,Fiona Muirhead,Karen White and Nancy Burns, all P6 and P7 children of Balmerino School.Typed by Alasdair Balfour.
